label: 鶴林
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: [Also tsuru no hayashi] Crane Grove" is an epithet applied to the grove of sal trees where Sākyamuni is reputed to have entered nirvana on the bank of the Hiranyavatī River near Kusinagara in India.  The trees are said to have turned white as cranes (p. 514n)."
